poem:
### Dream & Shadow

In the corridors of half-light,
dreams converge, shadowed whispers
mingle with the essence of dawn.
Not fairy magic, but the human heart's
secret longing, turning darkly bright,
summons a music the soul comprehends—
Britten's notes, Shakespeare's voice,
woven into the fabric of our most
intimate, nocturnal pilgrimage.
